info.title: API Banking - Trade
info.description:
**API Banking - Trade APIs**. 

 API Banking enables Standard Chartered Bank to offer a new way for you to interact with the Bank and to digitally transform your business. API is a quick and efficient way to exchange data between parties, making business data available to you and your nominated partners. Provides you the ability to: submit a Bank Guarantee (BG) free format, submit a Bank Guarantee (BG) / Standby Letter of Credit (SBLC) Application or Amendment Application through your own ERP or through agreed third party intermediary application between you and the Bank; upload and download of supporting documents for a Trade message; receive the Transaction Status Notification Messages.

tags.name: Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application
tags.description: Allows you to submit and amend a Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application.

tags.name: File Management
tags.description: Facilitates you to upload and download of a document related to a Trade message.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: Facilitates you to receive the Transaction Status Notification messages sent from Bank and manages webhook mechanism.

tags.name: Bank Guarantee - Free Format
tags.description: Allows you to submit the free format message.

tags.name: Trade Finance Limits
tags.description: Get real time trade finance limits for all the enabled products for corporate customer.Utilized amount, Available amount, Limit currency etc will be provided per product as part of the limit details

get.description: Get real time trade finance limits for all the enabled products for corporate customer based on the given SCB customer's back office reference and country details.Utilized amount, Available amount, Limit currency etc will be provided per product as part of the limit details.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

get.description: This API will be invoked when you require additional details on the Bank's Notification Messages. You are required to provide your Backoffice ID, Country Code and the Notification ID. When this API is called using the above stated parameters, Bank will retrieve the corresponding Notification Details Message and send it to you.

parameters.name: notificationID
parameters.description: Unique ID assigned to the Notification by Bank, which was sent in the Webhook notification.

200.description: The request has been accepted for processing.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing etc).

500.description: Internal Server Error due to Database related exception, Transformation related exception, Client related exception or Common exception

post.description: The Supporting documents - File Upload API will allow you to upload an attachment as a supporting document for a Trade message. Once received, the file will be saved in the Bank's File Management system and the corresponding Message ID will be sent to you.

200.description: OK. File will be stored temporarily. Message ID in the response message will be the Reference ID of the file that is to be included in the actual Trade application.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing etc).

text/plain.example: The server cannot process the request as the file size is too large.

429.description: The response status code indicates that you have sent too many requests.

text/plain.example: You have sent too many requests.
The server encountered an unexpected condition.

get.description: The Supporting documents - File Download API will allow you to download a document or an attachment. You are required to provide your Backoffice ID, Country Code and the Message ID. Once the call is received by the Bank, the file will be retrieved from the Bank's File Management system, after checking whether the file was uploaded by the same user.

parameters.name: messageID
parameters.description: The Message ID (File ID) assigned to the attachment by the Bank.

200.description: OK. The request has succeeded and the processing of the request is complete.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing etc).

text/plain.example: The server cannot process the request as the file size is too large.

429.description: The response status code indicates that you have sent too many requests.

text/plain.example: You have sent too many requests.
The server encountered an unexpected condition.

tags: Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application
post.summary: Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application - Submit
post.description: The Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application - Submit API exposes the ability to initiate either a Bank Guarantee or a Standby Letter of Credit. Among other information,  the terms and conditions of the Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit can be specified, the type of Guarantee (i.e. whether it is Advance Payment Bond, Performance Bond, etc), transmission medium for sending the Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit, specify the parties such as the Beneficiary, Advising Bank, Confirming Bank (if any). This API also allows you to specify the File ID generated by the Bank's File Management System in the attachment section of the message. Upon successful validation, the request will be submitted to the Bank for further processing.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the processing of the request is complete.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing etc).

errors.details: references.messageRef: null -> must not be blank

500.description: Internal Server Error due to Database related exception, Transformation related exception, Solace related exception or Common exception

tags: Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application
post.summary: Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application - Amend
post.description: The Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Application - Amend API exposes the ability to initiate a Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Amendment request for a previously issued Bank Guarantee or a Standby Letter of Credit. You would be able to amend the Expiry Details of the Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit, the Applicable Rules, the Bank Guarantee / Standby Letter of Credit Amount. This API also allows you to specify the File ID generated by the Bank's File Management System in the attachment section of the message. Upon successful validation, the request will be submitted to the Bank for further processing.

200.description: The request has been accepted for processing.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing etc).

errors.details: references.messageRef: null -> must not be blank

500.description: Internal Server Error due to Database related exception, Transformation related exception, Solace related exception or Common exception

id.description: notification id assigned by api banking

otherAction.description: if type=OTHER, this will have the type

timeStamp.description: Time of action by the bank

otherStatus.description: If status is not one of the listed, this will contain the status type.

TradeNotificationTransactionReferences.description: References for this application * messageRef: Reference assigned by the customer to unambiguously identify the api message. Useful for troubleshooting technical issues. * bankRef: Transaction number assigned by the bank

GteeNotificationDetail.description: Details of a bank guarantee notification

GteeNotificationDetailReferences.description: References for this application * customerRef: Application number assigned by the customer * bankRef: Transaction number assigned by the bank * messageRef: Reference assigned by the customer to unambiguously identify the message * businessRef: Business reference assigned by the customer * bankBusinessRef: Business reference assigned by the bank

CustomerIDBackoffice.description: Backoffice ID assigned by the bank to the customer

isRelated.description: whether this organisation is related to the customer

requestId.description: Unique request id assigned by the bank

receivedAt.description: Time at which the message was received

messageID.description: Unique message id assigned by the bank

receivedAt.description: Time at which the message was received

dealID.description: Deal reference assigned by the bank, once the message is processed.

form.description: The value for "form" is mandatory for corporate customers (Where the source system is either API or TNG)

beneficiary.description: The value for "beneficiary" is mandatory for corporate customers (Where the source system is either API or TNG)

GteeUndertakingExpiry.description: The value for "expiry.type" is mandatory for corporate customers (Where the source system is either API or TNG)

isRelated.description: whether this organisation is related to the customer

GteeUndertakingAmount.description: The value for "amount" is mandatory for corporate customers (Where the source system is either API or TNG)

FreeFormatMessageReferences.description: References for this application * messageRef: Reference assigned by the sending system to unambiguously identify the api message. Useful for troubleshooting technical issues. * customerRef: Reference assigned by the customer * bankRef: Reference assigned by the bank to the related transaction * bankBusinessRef: Business reference assigned by the bank

requestId.description: Unique request id assigned by the bank

receivedAt.description: Time at which the message was received

anchorLimits.description: Anchor Facility Summary (Program View) - It contains information on the limits & utilization for supply chain finance program clients.

tradeLimits.description: Trade Facility Summary (External) – It contains information on client's (main borrower/ co-borrower) trade limits approved by the bank

statusAsofTime.description: Last Updated Timestamp.This Should be a date in ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ.This is the recommended form of date/timestamp(Complete date plus hours, minutes, seconds and a decimal fraction of a second in ISO-8601 format)

outerLimits.description: Outer Limit [or the Parent Limit] is the maximum limit approved to a client in specific to a product category.

committed.description: Is the client committed to use the facility

availableAmount.description: Available Limit Amount in limit currency

innerLimits.description: Inner Limit [Baby Limit] operates within the Outer Limit to create flexibility for the client to utilize the approved loan facility.
